intro: Centaurea gallica, commonly known as French centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, branched stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its bright blue to purple flowers bloom from late spring to early autumn, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Centaurea gallica is often found in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas, and it has been used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
